court: Court at Blamont, with appeals to Change de Nancy

formal_accuser.name: Jean du Pont
formal_accuser.relationship_to_accused: village mayor, initiated case via placet

confession.devil_appearance: appeared in form of a black dog (in later confession)
confession.seduction_date: 2 years before arrest (initially confessed), later changed to 4 years earlier
confession.seduction_context: Seduced behind her house when 'toute desolée' (completely distressed) about accusations by Demenge Nicklauss. Devil promised to make her rich. Later said it was after quarrel with husband.

witnesses.name: Nicolas Nicklauss
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: Brother of Demenge Nicklauss who had conflicts with accused

testimony.quarrel_subject: Marriage negotiations - accused's brother Jean Simon was courting witness's brother's daughter Catherine, accused hoped for marriage, but she was married to another

harms_alleged.target: Two horses belonging to his brother Demenge Nicklauss
harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: around St Luc previous year, about a week after being touched

witnesses.name: Demenge Nicklauss (le maire)
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: neighbor, had marriage negotiations and land disputes

testimony.quarrel_subject: Land dispute - intended to operate 'retraicte' on land, and failed marriage negotiations between his daughter and accused's brother Jean Simon
testimony.threat_quote: Petite rouzeotte ou est ton pere il va querir des beaux poullains a Thiebausmesnil nompas

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: following day after accused spoke to her and sent her to look for geese
next day immediately after accused spoke to her again

testimony.quarrel_subject: marriage negotiations and illness of daughter
marriage of his sister and illness of Jehenne
Disputes with husband over communal fines and overcharging for wood
testimony.threat_quote: qu'il estoit trop haultain et qu'il ne fauldroit courrir trop fort pour le rattaindre

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: after horse became ill and knocked wife over
previous summer when she went into stable during house rebuilding

testimony.quarrel_subject: Her husband's horses damaged his field of oats, husband condemned to repay 5 quarterons
testimony.threat_quote: qu'il vauldroit mieulx qu'il ne les eust gagés que ce seroit de la cherre avoine pour luy et qu'avant qu'il fust un peu de temps il se donneroit de garde

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: soon after accepting oats from husband

testimony.quarrel_subject: Brother called Claudon fils Claudon Marchal 'fils de sorciere' while drinking, her husband Demenge Fennay defended her, fight ensued
testimony.threat_quote: qu'elle l'avoit hay cent et cent fois pour ce qu'elle hantoit et frequentoit au logis de Demenge Nicklauss (said to his mother); to witness she said she would remember it when he had forgotten

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: around last Chandeleur, after the threat

witnesses.name: Demenge de Chesnoy, dit Marchal
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: had quarrelled with husband and relatives

testimony.quarrel_subject: quarrelled with her husband and other relatives

witnesses.name: Jennon femme au maire Jean Dediat

testimony.quarrel_subject: Accused complained that witness and her sister spoke ill of her while hoeing, and sister's children called one of accused's children 'son of a witch'

witnesses.name: Jean Henry
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: father of Franceatte, had complained to accused about insults

testimony.quarrel_subject: Accused's grandchildren calling his son 'fils de sorciere' and remarks by his daughter Franceatte

witnesses.name: Laurent Bouzenotte
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: stepfather of former servant Claudon Benay

testimony.quarrel_subject: Stepson Claudon Benay had been servant in her house, left service and called her 'one of the witches' when passing her on road

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: about a month after calling her witch
on feast day of St Mathias after accused came to her door before dawn

witnesses.name: Vaultrin Louy
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: neighbor, accompanied Demenge Nicklauss to procureur fiscal

testimony.quarrel_subject: Quarrel with Demenge Nicklauss; witness accompanied Nicklauss to procureur fiscal at Blamont

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: shortly after Claudon called her 'one of the most perfect witches of Domjevin'

timeline.subject: maire Jean du Pont
timeline.details: Placet submitted by maire Jean du Pont to initiate case

timeline.subject: procureur fiscal of comté de Blamont
Chretienne Simon
timeline.details: Confrontations with witnesses - she attacked their credibility

timeline.subject: Chretienne Simon
timeline.details: Procureur fiscal asks for question ordinaire et extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Chretienne Simon
timeline.details: First torture session - thumbscrews, racked twice, confessed nothing

timeline.subject: Chretienne Simon
timeline.details: Second torture session - racked again, confessed to witchcraft for 2 years, seduction by Parsin, powders, sabbat

timeline.subject: Chretienne Simon
timeline.details: Procureur fiscal asks for question extraordinaire and death sentence

timeline.subject: Chretienne Simon
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves, subject to confirmation of confessions away from torture chamber

timeline.subject: Chretienne Simon
timeline.details: Attempted escape - bolted door at bottom of stairs at 4am

timeline.subject: Chretienne Simon
timeline.details: Interrogation away from torture - changed story, now said seduced 4 years earlier, admitted more harms

timeline.subject: Chretienne Simon
timeline.details: Final interrogation - confirmed previous confessions, left with priest

timeline.subject: Chretienne Simon
timeline.details: Undated death sentence from court at Blamont follows

torture.requesting_official: procureur fiscal of comté de Blamont

prior_accusations.context: Mother Chretienne executed as witch at Blamont 4 or 5 years earlier (around 1602-1603), since when accused had been suspected

notable_quotes.speaker: Chretienne Simon (to Nicolas Nicklauss when passing horses at night)
notable_quotes.french: En voila un noirre qui abbaye par la, on dict que c'est le chien du prevost d'Argeviller
notable_quotes.english: There is a black one barking over there, they say it's the dog of the prévôt of Ogéviller
notable_quotes.context: Night encounter when accused allegedly touched horses that later died

notable_quotes.speaker: Chretienne Simon (to Demenge Nicklauss's young daughter Jeanne)
notable_quotes.french: Petite rouzeotte ou est ton pere il va querir des beaux poullains a Thiebausmesnil nompas
notable_quotes.english: Little red-head, where is your father, he's going to get fine foals at Thiebausmesnil, isn't he
notable_quotes.context: Shortly before daughter became mentally disturbed

notable_quotes.speaker: Ambrosian father (about bewitched girl)
notable_quotes.french: ensorcellée par une femme qui ne demeuroit guiere loing de son logis et qui avoit bien envie de luy faire beaucoup de maulx
notable_quotes.english: bewitched by a woman who lived not far from her house and who had a strong desire to do her much harm
notable_quotes.context: Diagnosis of Jehenne's illness after exorcism

notable_quotes.speaker: Chretienne Simon (to Henry Mulnier during quarrel)
notable_quotes.french: qu'il estoit trop haultain et qu'il ne fauldroit courrir trop fort pour le rattaindre
notable_quotes.english: that he was too haughty and it wouldn't be necessary to run very fast to catch up with him
notable_quotes.context: Threatening statement during dispute over communal fines and wood charges

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean le Clerc (threat from Chretienne Simon)
notable_quotes.french: qu'il vauldroit mieulx qu'il ne les eust gagés que ce seroit de la cherre avoine pour luy et qu'avant qu'il fust un peu de temps il se donneroit de garde
notable_quotes.english: that it would be better if he hadn't won them, that it would be expensive oats for him and that before long he would beware
notable_quotes.context: After husband's horses damaged his field and he was awarded compensation

notable_quotes.speaker: Chretienne Simon (to mother of Pierson Nicolle)
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle l'avoit hay cent et cent fois pour ce qu'elle hantoit et frequentoit au logis de Demenge Nicklauss
notable_quotes.english: that she had hated her a hundred and a hundred times because she frequented the house of Demenge Nicklauss

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudon Benay (former servant, about Chretienne Simon)
notable_quotes.english: here is one of the witches
notable_quotes.context: Called out when passing her on road from Nancy

notable_quotes.speaker: Vaultrin Louy (reporting what Claudon de Benamesnil said)
notable_quotes.french: en voila une des plus parfaites sorcieres de Domjevin
notable_quotes.english: there is one of the most perfect witches of Domjevin
notable_quotes.context: Claudon's statement about Chretienne Simon before his drowning

notable_quotes.speaker: Chretienne Simon (in interrogation about Demenge Nicklauss)
notable_quotes.french: ung meschant homme, estimant que ladite haine est cause de son malheur et de son apprehention qu'il ne tasche qu'a luy faire deshonneur et la rendre meschante
notable_quotes.english: a wicked man, believing that said hatred is the cause of her misfortune and her arrest, that he seeks only to dishonor her and make her appear wicked
notable_quotes.context: When asked about hatreds in village

notable_quotes.speaker: Chretienne Simon (about testimony)
notable_quotes.french: que le papier se laissoit escrire et qu'elle recognoissoit bien que l'on y mestoit aussy bien des menteries qu'autres choses
notable_quotes.english: that paper allowed itself to be written on and that she recognized well that they put as many lies as other things on it
notable_quotes.context: Denying charges about harming Nicklauss's daughter

notable_quotes.speaker: Chretienne Simon (about pilgrimages for bewitchment)
notable_quotes.french: s'ils estoient en oppinion que ce fut de sorcellerie qu'ils n'en debvoient aller en pelerinage comme ils ont fait les appelants tousjours meschantes gens et traistres qu'ils taschent bien de luy causer ung malheur, toutesfois qu'elle esperoit qu'ils n'y adviendroient et qu'ils faisoient en cela leurs damnations
notable_quotes.english: if they were of the opinion that it was witchcraft they shouldn't go on pilgrimage as they did, calling them always wicked people and traitors who are trying hard to cause her misfortune, however she hoped they would not succeed and that they were doing their damnation in this

daughter of le maire Simon and his wife Chretienne
her brother Jean Simon was courting brother's daughter Catherine
guarding horses of his brother Demenge Nicklauss
her brother Jean Simon was courting brother's daughter Catherine
servant of Fennay, Claudon Bennay of Benaumesnil
father of the witness, Jean Henry
her sister Sebille femme Nicolas Estienne
His wife's son Claudon Benay, aged 16

relationships.person2: Jennon femme au maire Jean Dediat
relationships.evidence_text: Jennon, femme au maire Jean Dediat
Claudon fils Claudon Marchal 'fils de sorciere' - his mother had been executed at Blamont

economic_context.details: Multiple disputes mentioned: land 'retraicte' dispute between Demenge Nicklauss and Demenge Jean Jean; Henry Mulnier as 'Imbault' had disputes with accused's husband over delayed communal fines and alleged overcharging for wood; accused claimed Demenge Nicklauss used false measure and stole wood at Ognieviller; Jean le Clerc's field of oats damaged by accused's husband's horses, awarded 5 quarterons compensation

harms_catalog.victim_name: Two horses belonging to Demenge Nicklauss
harms_catalog.harm_description: Became ill, refusing to eat, died within an hour of time when touched
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Marriage negotiations failed - accused's brother wanted to marry Nicklauss's daughter
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: around St Luc previous year, a week after being touched
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Put hand on mane of one horse, sprinkled something on back of others

harms_catalog.harm_description: Became ill for 2 weeks but recovered
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Same marriage dispute

harms_catalog.harm_description: Became 'perturbée de son entendement' (disturbed in understanding/mentally ill), returned with every new moon
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Failed marriage negotiations and land dispute
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: following day after accused spoke to her and sent her to look for geese
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Speaking to her, calling her 'Petite rouzeotte', sending her to look for geese

harms_catalog.victim_name: Two horses belonging to Demenge Nicklauss
harms_catalog.harm_description: Deaths of 2 horses
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Marriage and land disputes

harms_catalog.harm_description: Became as if rabid, making great disturbance in stable at night
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Disputes over communal fines and overcharging for wood

harms_catalog.harm_description: In bed for 5 or 6 weeks, so ill expected to die
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Dispute with husband
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: after horse became rabid and knocked her over
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Brought five eggs, one cracked - eating them cured her

harms_catalog.harm_description: Became ill but recovered after a week
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Previous summer, entered stable during house rebuilding
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Went into stable as far as stable area

harms_catalog.harm_description: Sickened and died before reaching house
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Husband's horses damaged his oats field, he was awarded 5 quarterons
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: soon after accepting half resal of oats from husband
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Wished horse might never return home as he led it past her house

harms_catalog.harm_description: Death of cow
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Same dispute
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Cow chewed some straw outside her house

harms_catalog.victim_name: Foal belonging to mother of Pierson Nicolle
harms_catalog.harm_description: Death of foal
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Brother called Claudon Marchal 'fils de sorciere', husband defended her, fight ensued; witness said witches should be quiet
harms_catalog.method_alleged: After telling mother she hated her for frequenting Nicklauss's house

harms_catalog.victim_name: Two horses and a foal of Franceatte
harms_catalog.harm_description: Lost 2 horses and a foal
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Accused complained about witness and sister speaking ill of her, sister's children calling accused's child 'son of a witch'

harms_catalog.harm_description: Death of 3 horses
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Accused's grandchildren calling his son 'fils de sorciere', his daughter Franceatte's remarks

harms_catalog.harm_description: Drowned in river - horse ran away with him and threw him in river during floods
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Former servant who left her service, called her 'one of the witches' when passing on road

harms_catalog.victim_name: Cow of Bastienne femme Nicolas Simonatte
harms_catalog.harm_description: Cow died
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Unclear - cow tended to go to accused's house

harms_catalog.harm_description: Eyes started to stream so couldn't see to sew, whole body became swollen, had to go to bed, still suffering back pains
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Unknown - witness didn't know how she displeased her
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: same evening after accused came to door before dawn on St Mathias
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Knocked on door before dawn, possibly threw something over her when she opened without light; brought lard that cured her

harms_catalog.harm_description: Found drowned
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Called her 'one of the most perfect witches of Domjevin' while passing her on road

harms_catalog.harm_description: Killed calf
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Quarrelled with her brother

harms_catalog.harm_description: Died - used as test for powder
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: None - testing powder
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Yellow powder to kill - testing it out

harms_catalog.victim_name: Cow of Jennon veuve le Gal
harms_catalog.harm_description: Killed cow
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Jennon had been breaking her garden fence

harms_catalog.harm_description: Killed cow
Given permission to master in form of black dog to kill horses
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Long-standing dispute with Nicklauss
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Gave devil permission in form of black dog

Magical powders allegedly given by devil - yellow to kill, white to heal, red to harm animals
Devil gave accused red mask at sabbat, she left it on willow-tree

Torture instrument used multiple times

Location of horse illness and death; accused entered Henry Mulnier's stable
Demenge Fennay tore collar off witness's brother's shirt in fight

historical_context.military_details: German soldier mentioned - Franceatte allegedly had child by German soldier and was given cloth to hush it up, commonly called 'allemande' as result
weather_events: floods mentioned when Claudon Benay drowned
economic_hardship_indicators: multiple disputes over small amounts of grain and wood
accusations of false measure and theft
economic value of horses and livestock crucial - multiple deaths economically devastating

officials_named.name: procureur fiscal of comté de Blamont

prior_legal_disputes.description: Quarrel with Demenge Nicklauss over land 'retraicte' - went before procureur fiscal at Blamont who made accord with penalty of 'boisson' for breaking it
prior_legal_disputes.outcome: Accord made but accused decided to pay penalty rather than keep it, went to Lunéville to inform procureur

prior_legal_disputes.description: Demenge Nicklauss blamed her for death of horses, she wanted to take him to court but couldn't prove what he said
Accused claimed Demenge Nicklauss had stolen wood at Ognieviller
Dispute with Henry Mulnier over communal fines and wood charges

legal_context.redress_outcome: Unable to take Demenge Nicklauss to court for defamation because couldn't prove what he said; went before procureur fiscal who made accord
legal_context.imprisonment_conditions: Guards in room; attempted escape on August 24 by bolting door at bottom of stairs at 4am

change_de_nancy.modification_details: Approved torture (11 Aug 1607) and death sentence (22 Aug 1607) subject to confirmation of confessions away from torture chamber before execution

hearsay_chains.content: Heard his master telling off his wife over rumour she killed the two horses, she swore she hadn't done it but believed it was wife of Toussaint Henry
If accused knew what they had said about her while hoeing, the devil her master must have told her
Claimed he had seen such things in her house that he believed she was a true witch; her eldest son aged 7 or 8 told Claudon that his mother wanted to take him with her
Described how her husband returned from tavern, called her 'carogne', told her of accusation over horses; she denied it; he said he would beat servant; she begged him not to

hearsay_chains.reporter: Jennon femme au maire Jean Dediat
hearsay_chains.content: Had heard from husband of some suspicions but no personal ones

emotional_state_notes: Made some difficulty about renouncing devil before finally doing so
Had often cried over rumours she was to be arrested, shutting herself up in her room
Claimed something in body prevented her from telling truth during torture and made her lie

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Said she did not know Laurent Bougenotte well, but had heard he had a bad reputation, and several including his own son had called him a witch
Called Nicolas Nicklauss 'une vielle charogne et un viel dampné' (an old carrion and an old damned one), said he originally suspected wife of Toussaint Henry over deaths

Claimed Demenge Nicklauss had been fined for theft of wood, used false measure; claimed he gave his daughter instructions in writing about what to depose; said his wife Catherine had been reputed a witch for 16 years
Said Jean Nicklauss kept company with Mre Jean du Pont who had been hung in effigy and 'luy apprend toute meschanceté' (teaches him all wickedness)
Claimed Henry Mulnier, his brother, and his sister were all reputed witches
Said Pierson Nicolle threatened to chase rats out of cousin's house which burned down 2 weeks later; reproached with setting it alight without seeking reparation
Said Jean le Clerc had long reputation as witch and thief
Said Annel femme Henry Mulnier was a thief
Said Franceotte was a whore, having had child by German soldier, given cloth to hush it up, commonly called 'allemande'
Said Jean Henry supposedly drowned man named Didier Pierson in river returning from tavern at Ogéviller, tried to kill someone on road and steal his purse
Said Bastienne femme Nicolas Simonatte was a whore who had child by another man, which is why husband didn't see her willingly
Said Vaultrin Louy had committed theft in mill at Blemerey

third_parties.name: Chretienne (mother of accused)
third_parties.context: Executed as witch at Blamont 4 or 5 years before this trial (around 1602-1603), since when accused had been suspected

third_parties.name: Jean Simon
third_parties.relationship_to_witness: was courting daughter of Demenge Nicklauss
third_parties.context: Courted Catherine, daughter of Demenge Nicklauss; accused hoped for marriage but she was married to another

third_parties.name: Catherine (daughter of Demenge Nicklauss)
third_parties.context: Was courted by Jean Simon but married to another, sparking quarrel

third_parties.name: Claudon Bennay (Benay)
third_parties.context: Aged 16, served in accused's house, claimed to see things that made him believe she was witch; left service, called her witch, drowned about month later

third_parties.name: Demenge Fennay
third_parties.context: Husband of accused; defended her honor; had disputes with Henry Mulnier and others; accused said he didn't believe she was witch and would defend her strongly

third_parties.name: wife of Toussaint Henry Toussaint
third_parties.context: Accused's husband allegedly said she (not accused) was responsible for death of horses; Nicolas Nicklauss originally suspected her

third_parties.name: Ambrosian fathers at St Nicolas
third_parties.context: Performed exorcism on Jehenne, diagnosed her as bewitched by woman living nearby who wanted to do much harm

third_parties.name: Claudon fils Claudon Marchal
third_parties.context: Called 'fils de sorciere' by Pierson Nicolle's brother while drinking - his mother had been executed at Blamont

third_parties.name: Claudon Marchal (mother)
third_parties.context: Executed as witch at Blamont

third_parties.name: wife of Nicolas Gossat
third_parties.context: Working nearby when Franceatte was hoeing; commented that if accused knew what they said, devil must have told her

third_parties.name: Sebille femme Nicolas Estienne
third_parties.context: Accused complained about her speaking ill; her children called accused's child 'son of a witch'

third_parties.name: Pierron Courrexier (?)
third_parties.context: Maire whose house Claudon Benay went to after leaving accused's service

third_parties.name: Jennon veuve le Gal
third_parties.context: Accused confessed to killing her cow with red powder after she broke garden fence

third_parties.name: Didier Pierson
third_parties.context: Accused claimed Jean Henry drowned him in river when returning from tavern at Ogéviller

third_parties.name: Mre Jean du Pont
third_parties.context: Had been hung in effigy; accused claimed he taught Jean Nicklauss all wickedness; was maire who initiated case with placet

third_parties.name: German soldier
third_parties.context: Accused claimed Franceatte had child by German soldier

third_parties.name: eldest son of accused (aged 7 or 8)
third_parties.context: Allegedly told Claudon Benay that his mother wanted to take him with her; she beat him when she overheard

third_parties.name: Mengin Saba (Caba)
third_parties.context: Had quarrelled with husband; devil Parsin wanted her to harm him but she refused because he was a relative; his servant had red dog

third_parties.name: Demenge Jean Jean
third_parties.context: Bought land that Demenge Nicklauss wanted to operate 'retraicte' on; his son was involved in marriage negotiations

third_parties.name: Lucie veuve Claudon Nicolle
third_parties.context: Accused denied hating her but admitted not associating with those who frequented Nicklauss's house

third_parties.name: Claudon de Benamesnil
third_parties.context: Was with Vaultrin Louy returning from Nancy, called accused 'one of the most perfect witches of Domjevin', found drowned shortly after

extraction_metadata.notes: Exceptionally detailed trial record with 19 witnesses, extensive confrontations, torture sessions, confession under duress, and execution. Accused was daughter of executed witch. Key themes: failed marriage negotiations, multiple animal deaths (especially horses), economic disputes, accusations spreading through Nicklauss family network. Accused vigorously defended herself by attacking credibility of all witnesses during confrontations. Confession only came under torture and involved typical elements (devil Parsin, powders, sabbat, sexual relations). Trial demonstrates pattern of reputation-harm-accusation cycle and role of prior family execution in establishing suspicion.
